intro: Tricostularia neesii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with upright stems and clusters of small, brightly colored blooms. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth. Tricostularia neesii is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
